CatDescriptText: Mr. Matthew Gee, shearman, Manilla Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column, published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 8, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "Do you think that women should wear Bermuda or walking shorts, or similar apparel, while walking along the streets?" answer reads: "If the apparel is nice and decent, it's all right for the younger people, but not for older persons. I would say that around 16 or 17 years of age, it's all right, but after that, they should stop.  Women shouldn't wear things which are overbearing."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Matthew Gee wearing Hawaiian style shirt and cap, standing in front of brick building
